intro: Euploca dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored euploca, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white to pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Euploca dichroa is often found in the southeastern U.S., particularly in states like Georgia and Florida.
